importantArticles.headline: Delta Air Lines (DAL) is set to kick off airline earnings on Wednesday. Wealth host Brad Smith joins Catalysts with Madison Mills to outline what to watch as airline earnings come through, highlighting key names like American Air, (AAL) United Airlines (UAL), and Southwest (LUV). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.
importantArticles.title: Delta to kick off airline earnings: What to expect

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- UBS downgraded Alaska Air (NYSE:ALK), Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL), and United Airlines from Buy to Neutral warning that a likely U.S. recession could weigh on revenue and profits across the airline sector.
importantArticles.title: UBS downgrades US airlines on recession fears, sees lower earnings

importantArticles.headline: On today's Market Minute, Julie Hyman takes a closer look at the trending stories on Wall Street, including NewsMax (NMAX) extending its post–initial public offering (IPO) gains, Jefferies downgrading airline stocks Delta (DAL), American Airlines (AAL), and Southwest (LUV), and rising sales for General Motors (GM). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: NewsMax surges, airlines downgraded, GM sales rise: Market Minute

importantArticles.headline: American Airlines Group (NasdaqGS:AAL) saw its share price decline by 11% over the past week, which may be linked to recent market stressors, including a downgrade from Jefferies affecting airline stocks like AAL due to concerns over consumer sentiment and economic uncertainty. The airline sector has been under pressure as a result of broader market volatility tied to potential U.S. tariff announcements projected to influence macroeconomic factors. importantArticles.title: American Airlines Group (NasdaqGS:AAL) Hit by Jefferies Downgrade as Shares Drop 11% Over the Past Week

importantArticles.headline: Airline stocks slumped Tuesday after Jefferies analysts lowered their ratings for three of the four major U.S. carriers, writing “consumer sentiment continues to disappoint.”
importantArticles.title: US Airline Stocks Slip as Jefferies Downgrades Major Carriers
